[Home](./index.md) &gt; [@ugdu/processor](./processor.md) &gt; [HookDriver](./processor.hookdriver.md)

## HookDriver class

Provides features like invoking corresponding `hook fn`<!-- -->s according to `hook name` in [HookType](./processor.hooktype.md) mode, hooking into children `hookd driver`<!-- -->, etc.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare class HookDriver<Hooks extends BaseHooks<Hooks>, HookName extends keyof Hooks = keyof Hooks> 
```

## Constructors

|  Constructor | Modifiers | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [(constructor)(\_hns)](./processor.hookdriver._constructor_.md) |  | Constructs a new instance of the <code>HookDriver</code> class |

## Properties

|  Property | Modifiers | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- | --- |
|  [children](./processor.hookdriver.children.md) |  | [HookDriver](./processor.hookdriver.md)<!-- -->&lt;any, any&gt;\[\] | The children <code>hook driver</code>. User could hook in the children <code>hook driver</code> by invoking the [HookDriver.hook()](./processor.hookdriver.hook.md) method of the parent. It looks like the parent <code>hook driver</code> itself provides those hooks. By doing so, user only need to know which and what hooks are provided by the driver they are using. |

## Methods

|  Method | Modifiers | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [call(name, type, args)](./processor.hookdriver.call.md) |  | Invokes corresponding <code>hook fn</code>s according to <code>name</code> in [type](./processor.hooktype.md) mode. |
|  [hfs(name)](./processor.hookdriver.hfs.md) |  |  |
|  [hook(name, fn)](./processor.hookdriver.hook.md) |  | Appends <code>fn</code> to <code>hook fn</code>s. |
|  [prepend(name, fn)](./processor.hookdriver.prepend.md) |  | Prepends <code>fn</code> to <code>hook fn</code>s. |
|  [unhook(name, fn)](./processor.hookdriver.unhook.md) |  | Remove <code>fn</code> from <code>hook fn</code>s. |
